numbered_ace_sentences: 1. The graph shows the percentage of young people who say that they talk to their parents at least once a day or a few times a week.
2. The graph shows a difference between the number of young women questioned and the number of young men questioned.
3. The graph shows the communication methods that participants use to contact their parents.
4. Women communicate with their parents more than men communicate with their parents in every communication category.
5. Texting is used more frequently than other methods to contact parents.
6. Visiting in person is the least common method to contact parents.
7. I wonder why women contact their parents more than men contact their parents.
8. I wonder why people visit their parents in person less often.
9. This topic is relevant to me and to the community.
10. Personal communication with one's parents is important.
11. Many people of my age plan to go to college.
12. I plan to go to college.
13. Texting parents is a convenient way to stay in touch.
14. Calling parents is a convenient way to stay in touch.
15. Texting parents is especially convenient for people who go out of state.
16. Calling parents is especially convenient for people who go out of state.
17. The headline is: Maintaining Contact: How do teens get in touch with their parents?
